content.webTitle: BAA trims forecast for passenger growth

fields.headline: BAA trims forecast for passenger growth
fields.bodyText: Airports operator BAA yesterday trimmed its forecast for passenger growth through its seven UK airports this year, blaming the Gate Gourmet dispute and the London bombings in July. The company said it expected growth of 3% compared with earlier projections of 3.5%. BAA said in the first five months of its financial year its airports handled 66 million passengers. The operator said net retail income was up by 1% per passenger and that the construction of the £4.2bn Terminal Five at Heathrow was now more than 65% completed, was on budget and ahead of schedule.
